code: @Manual{,   title = {fude: Utilities for Fude Polygon},   author = {Takeshi Nishimura},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/takeshinishimura/fude, https://takeshinishimura.github.io/fude/}, }

title: Utilities for Fude Polygon
text: fude package provides utilities facilitate handling Fude Polygon data downloadable Ministry Agriculture, Forestry Fisheries (MAFF) website. word fude Japanese counter suffix used referring land parcels.

title: Utilities for Fude Polygon
text: Download Fude Polygon data following release site MAFF (Japanese available). https://open.fude.maff.go.jp

title: Utilities for Fude Polygon
text: can install released version fude CRAN : development version GitHub :

title: Utilities for Fude Polygon
text: can let R read downloaded ZIP file without unzipping . function inspired kokudosuuchi: Utilities ‘Kokudo Suuchi’. wish use mouse trackpad file selection, especially common among R beginners, can following. can rename local government codes Japanese municipality names easier handling. can also renamed romaji instead Japanese.
code: library(fude) d <- read_fude("~/2022_382019.zip") #> Reading layer `2022_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/RtmpmzTpxf/file65925ccfdc0c/2022_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 72045 features and 10 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.4962 ymin: 33.70162 xmax: 132.8954 ymax: 34.01602 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 d <- read_fude(file.choose()) d2 <- rename_fude(d) #> 2022_382019 -> 2022_松山市 d3 <- d |> rename_fude(suffix = FALSE, romaji = "title") #> 2022_382019 -> 2022_Matsuyama

what: Extract specified Fude Polygon data — extract_fude
title: Extract specified Fude Polygon data — extract_fude
text: extract_fude() extracts specified data list returned read_fude().

title: Extract specified Fude Polygon data — extract_fude
code: extract_fude(data, year = NULL, city = NULL, list = TRUE)

title: Extract specified Fude Polygon data — extract_fude
text: data List sf::sf() objects. year Year extracted. year city specified, objects recent year extracted. city Local government name (code) extracted. list Logical. FALSE, object extracted longer list.

title: Extract specified Fude Polygon data — extract_fude
text: list sf::sf() object(s).

title: Extract specified Fude Polygon data — extract_fude
code: path <- system.file("extdata", "castle.zip", package = "fude") d <- read_fude(path) #> Reading layer `2021_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file6602f614de2/castle/2021_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382019' from data source  #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382078' from data source  #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.541 ymin: 33.50931 xmax: 132.5415 ymax: 33.50966 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 d2 <- extract_fude(d, year = 2022, city = '\u677e\u5c71\u5e02') d |> extract_fude(year = 2022) #> $`2022_382019` #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   X_color X_opacity X_weight X_fillColor X_fillOpacity #> 1 #000000       0.5        3     #ff0000           0.5 #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.541 ymin: 33.50931 xmax: 132.5415 ymax: 33.50966 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #>   X_color X_opacity X_weight X_fillColor X_fillOpacity #> 1 #000000       0.5        3     #ff0000 code: path <- system.file("extdata", "castle.zip", package = "fude") d <- read_fude(path) #> Reading layer `2021_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file66026f016872/castle/2021_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file66026f016872/castle/2022_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382078' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file66026f016872/castle/2022_382078.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.541 ymin: 33.50931 xmax: 132.5415 ymax: 33.50966 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 ls_fude(d) #> $`2021` #> [1] "382019" #>  #> $`2022` #> [1] "382019" "382078" #>

what: Read a Fude Polygon ZIP file — read_fude
title: Read a Fude Polygon ZIP file — read_fude
text: read_fude() reads Fude Polygon data list. data can downloaded MAFF website ZIP file, contains one GeoJSON format files. function also work ZIP file created, long change filenames original GeoJSON files.

title: Read a Fude Polygon ZIP file — read_fude
Read a Fude Polygon ZIP file — read_fude
text: path Path ZIP file containing one GeoJSON format files.

title: Read a Fude Polygon ZIP file — read_fude
text: list sf::sf() objects.

title: Read a Fude Polygon ZIP file — read_fude
code: path <- system.file("extdata", "castle.zip", package = "fude") d <- read_fude(path) #> Reading layer `2021_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file66026156650f/castle/2021_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file66026156650f/castle/2022_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382078' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file66026156650f/castle/2022_382078.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.541 ymin: 33.50931 xmax: 132.5415 ymax: 33.50966 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84

what: Rename the Fude Polygon data — rename_fude
title: Rename the Fude Polygon data — rename_fude
text: rename_fude() renames local government code list returned read_fude() corresponding Japanese name order make data human-friendly.

title: Rename the Fude Polygon data — rename_fude
Rename the Fude Polygon data — rename_fude
text: data List sf::sf() objects. suffix Logical. FALSE, suffixes "SHI" "KU" local government names removed. romaji NULL, rename local government name romaji instead Japanese. Note romanization may correct. Romanji format upper case unless specified. "title": Title case. "lower": Lower case. "upper": Upper case.

title: Rename the Fude Polygon data — rename_fude
text: list sf::sf() objects.

title: Rename the Fude Polygon data — rename_fude
code: path <- system.file("extdata", "castle.zip", package = "fude") d <- read_fude(path) #> Reading layer `2021_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file660237d7beed/castle/2021_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382019' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file660237d7beed/castle/2022_382019.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.7653 ymin: 33.84506 xmax: 132.7662 ymax: 33.84575 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> Reading layer `2022_382078' from data source  #>   `/private/var/folders/33/1nmp7drn6c56394qxrzb2cth0000gn/T/Rtmp6dDqtd/file660237d7beed/castle/2022_382078.json'  #>   using driver `GeoJSON' #> Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 5 fields #> Geometry type: POLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: 132.541 ymin: 33.50931 xmax: 132.5415 ymax: 33.50966 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 d2 <- rename_fude(d) #> 2021_382019 -> 2021_松山市 #> 2022_382019 -> 2022_松山市 #> 2022_382078 -> 2022_大洲市 d2 <- rename_fude(d, suffix = FALSE) #> 2021_382019 -> 2021_松山 #> 2022_382019 -> 2022_松山 #> 2022_382078 -> 2022_大洲 d2 <- d |> rename_fude(romaji = "upper") #> 2021_382019 -> 2021_MATSUYAMA-SHI #> 2022_382019 -> 2022_MATSUYAMA-SHI #> 2022_382078 -> 2022_OZU-SHI
